Description: Body sherd of Laconian, probably black-figured pottery kylix; dull cream slip; interior: painted decoration consisting of tips of pomegranate frieze; exterior: wide band in added red between narrow black bands; below, frieze of short rays above narrow black band.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B7.4.4)
Stibbe 1972 / Lakonische Vasenmaler des sechsten Jahrhunderts v. Chr. (p. 241, no. 183, pl. 56.5-6)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 555, no. E22)
Venit 1985 / Laconian Black Figure Pottery in Egypt (p. 396, no. 22)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 240, no. 22)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GC.16) (Phase 1)
